events.name: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_label: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.
events.description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.

events.name: Inflation Increase
events.wd_description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.
events.description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.

events.name: Energy Price Surge
events.wd_description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.
events.description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.

events.name: Economic Recession Projection
events.wd_description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.
events.description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.

events.name: Dismissal of Germany's Cybersecurity Chief
events.wd_description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.
events.description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.

events.name: Dismissal of Schönbohm
events.wd_description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.
events.description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.

events.name: Allegations of Russian Connections
events.wd_description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.
events.description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.

events.name: Public Scrutiny
events.wd_description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.
events.description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.

events.name: Russian Drone Attacks on Kyiv
events.wd_description: At least four people were killed, and several others injured, as Russia launched a barrage of Iranian-made "kamikaze" drone attacks on Kyiv, with Ukrainian forces responding by shooting down many of the drones.
events.description: At least four people were killed, and several others injured, as Russia launched a barrage of Iranian-made "kamikaze" drone attacks on Kyiv, with Ukrainian forces responding by shooting down many of the drones.

events.name: Drone Attacks
events.wd_description: Russia launched a series of Iranian-made "kamikaze" drones targeting Kyiv, resulting in the deaths of at least four people and setting off warning sirens across the city.
events.description: Russia launched a series of Iranian-made "kamikaze" drones targeting Kyiv, resulting in the deaths of at least four people and setting off warning sirens across the city.

events.name: Ukrainian Response
events.wd_description: The Ukrainian Air Force and security forces destroyed 37 drones and three cruise missiles, including 36 out of 42 drones launched by Russia on Monday.
events.description: The Ukrainian Air Force and security forces destroyed 37 drones and three cruise missiles, including 36 out of 42 drones launched by Russia on Monday.

events.name: Casualties and Rescues
events.wd_description: Four people were killed, four injured, and 19 trapped individuals were rescued from the debris following the drone attacks in Kyiv.
events.description: Four people were killed, four injured, and 19 trapped individuals were rescued from the debris following the drone attacks in Kyiv.

events.name: CATL's German Factory Achieves Lithium-Ion Battery Cell Mass Production
events.wd_label: CATL's German Factory Achieves Lithium-Ion Battery Cell Mass Production
events.wd_description: CATL's first overseas factory in Thuringia, Germany, has successfully achieved mass production of lithium-ion battery cells, marking a significant milestone in CATL's global expansion.
events.description: CATL's first overseas factory in Thuringia, Germany, has successfully achieved mass production of lithium-ion battery cells, marking a significant milestone in CATL's global expansion.

events.name: Mass Production Achievement
events.wd_description: The first batch of battery cells from CATL's German factory was successfully produced by the first cell production line in the G2 building, with other production lines being installed and commissioned.
events.description: The first batch of battery cells from CATL's German factory was successfully produced by the first cell production line in the G2 building, with other production lines being installed and commissioned.

events.name: Production Line and Capacity Expansion
events.wd_description: CATL is working to ramp up the capacity of its German factory, which received an 8GWh cell production license in April and started module production in the G1 building in the third quarter of 2021.
events.description: CATL is working to ramp up the capacity of its German factory, which received an 8GWh cell production license in April and started module production in the G1 building in the third quarter of 2021.

events.name: Local Production and Supply Capability
events.wd_description: The successful production of these battery cells signifies CATL's ability to produce and supply locally for European customers, having passed all necessary global product tests.
events.description: The successful production of these battery cells signifies CATL's ability to produce and supply locally for European customers, having passed all necessary global product tests.
